result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcus Lavell Lee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Hit and Run-Involve Death, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Restitution payable to Charles H. for $445.00, to Jeffrey K. for $4,900.00 and to Milwaukee County Burial Assistance for $500.00 or civil judgment with tax intercept.  Charles H. and Jeffrey K. are to be paid first, proportionally.  Restitution is to be paid first before any costs, fees, surcharges or supervision fees.

Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Consecutive to: with credit for 225 days time served, consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: No driving without a valid drivers license.

Cognitive intervention programming.
Defendant is to obtain a valid drivers license if eligible.

Defendant to participate in alcohol and drug assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol. Unless medically assisted treatment. Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.

supervisions.notes:
No firearms; weapons.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank. Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcus Lavell Lee

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (28 pages) commencing NOVEMBER 20, 2015 received and filed. kl

Defendant Marcus Lavell Lee in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Marcus Lavell Lee in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for sentencing hearing.
Defense requests to begin sentencing hearing this morning, though it will not be finished before lunch.  State placed offer on the record.  Court found state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the state and defense.  Additional statements by: Gerald M. and Shanell L.  Restitution packet filed and received on behalf of the State.  Case passed to the afternoon session at 1:30 pm.

Case recalled at 1:33 pm.  Statement by defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 12 YEARS, with credit for 225 days time served, consecutive to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 6 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 6 YEARS.  The defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and IS NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
* Cognitive intervention programming.
* Defendant to participate in alcohol and drug assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol. Unless medically assisted treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Defendant is to obtain a valid drivers license if eligible.
* No driving without a valid drivers license.
* No firearms; weapons.
* Court ordered defendants drivers license revoked for a period of 5 years.
* Restitution payable to Charles H. for $445.00, to Jeffrey K. for $4,900.00 and to Milwaukee County Burial Assistance for $500.0 or civil judgment with tax intercept.  Charles H. and Jeffrey K. are to be paid first, proportionally.  Restitution is to be paid first before any costs, fees, surcharges or supervision fees.
* Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank. Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Restitution packet on behalf of state received and filed.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Marcus Lavell Lee in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Marcus Lavell Lee in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk: LMS.  

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

COUNT 2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marcus Lavell Lee in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Marcus Lavell Lee in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defense finds no legal basis to object to the conviction.  Court rules the open case and conviction is relevant and GRANTS State's MOTION TO INTRODUCE OTHER ACTS EVIDENCE
STATE'S BRIEF IN SUPPORT OF MOTION TO INTRODUCE OTHER ACTS EVIDENCE, received and filed. lms

Attorney Ann T. Bowe in court, defendant Marcus Lavell Lee not in court, in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case is adjourned for motion hearing, final pretrial conference and for jury trial in Branch 10.
Filed, signed Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order.  
All parties are notified that effective August  3, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Ellen Brostrom, Branch 6,  in Room 423 of the Safety Building.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 10:00 am.
To reschedule the scheduling conference set for 7/24/15, as the court will be down on that date. Scheduling conference scheduled for 7/21/15 at 8:30am in branch 10.

Defendant Marcus Lavell Lee in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for Grant Huebner for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for a plea hearing. Defense still awaiting additional discovery and requests an adjournment.   Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 10.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Ann T. Bowe in court, defendant Marcus Lavell Lee not in court, in custody.  
Kevin Shomin for Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Plea Hearing.  Order for Substitution of Counsel signed by the Court on today; Attorney Ann Bowe privately retained.  Defense motion to adjourn granted as ADA Grant Huebner in jury trial before Branch 38.  Case adjourned before Branch 10.  Adjourned plea hearing scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Stipulation and Order for Substitution of Counsel, signed and filed.

Attorney Jessica Bellows in court, defendant Marcus Lavell Lee not in court, in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch10. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marcus Lavell Lee in court with attorney Jessica Bellows.  Defendant Marcus Lavell Lee in custody.  Paul Tiffin for Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dugan, Branch 10.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 10.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.

Defendant Marcus Lavell Lee in court with attorney Mindy M. Nolan.  Defendant Marcus Lavell Lee in custody.  
Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dugan, Branch 10.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. 
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4).

Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
